column1: The child promised to be as prudent as if she were a grown-up woman
column3: by the time the winged dragons had whirled the car out of sight
column4: she was already on the shore
column5: calling to the sea-nymphs to come and play with her. They knew Proserpina's voice
column6: and were not long in showing their glistening faces and sea-green hair above the water
column7: at the bottom of which was their home. They brought along with them a great many beautiful shells; and
column8: sitting down on the moist sand
column9: where the surf wave broke over them
column10: they busied themselves in making a necklace
column11: which they hung round Proserpina's neck. By way of showing her gratitude
column12: the child besought them to go with her a little way into the fields
column13: so that they might gather abundance of flowers
column14: with which she would make each of her kind playmates a wreath.
